# necro ⇔ negro night ?

𓊻 necropolis

𓈖 𓐍 𓃀 𓇑 𓏏 𓅐 | Nekhbet | •necro-ba'at

𓈖𓇥𓂋𓏏𓀜 underground 𓌨 <> necropolis 𓈖𓇥𓂋𓏏𓀜 incarceration 𓈖𓇥𓂋𓏏𓀜 Nieder court "prison" Kerker

𓈖 𓏏 𓂋 𓏯 𓅐 ⲛⲟϣⲉⲣ ⇔ necro 𓊻 ⇔ nature 𓈖 𓇑 𓇑 𓏏 𓇳
𓈖 𓏏 𓂋 𓏯 𓅭 | vulture | •nadzar nattoraliusaq ⇔ nattoralik (“eagle”) @ Greenlandic
𓈖 𓍇 𓏌 𓁹 | see, look | nadzar : sight, look نَظَرَ naẓara negɑh-kardan@Pers!

𓈖 𓐍 𓈖 𓀔 𓀀 children ⇔ necron niños niñas new youth generations
𓇑 𓃀 𓏌 𓏏 | Nekhbet (goddess) | 𓈖 𓐍 𓃀 𓇑 𓏏 𓅐 Nekhbet ⇔ goddess of birth 𓃀 𓏌 𓏏
𓇑 𓇑 𓈖 𓈖 𓇋 𓇋 𓏲 𓀉 𓏱 𓏥 | inert ones (the Dead) | assassined? ⇔ necro?

necro vs 𓋹𓈖𓐍 •nakhᵘᵐ נשם נָשַׁם nashám ܢܦܫ 𓂊 nâšam 👃 "breath, life"

𓅱 𓊃 𓇱 | die out (of a race) | uz…necro aussterben

𓄫 •Nahrt ⇔ necro 𓄫 𓏲 𓏱 (death)

necō => necat@Latin "he kills, he murders" <> cut

ναρκό narkó “put to sleep” causative as¬narko : 𓋴 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍 Schnörkel

𓎼 𓏏 𓎛 𓀉 | be tired | nekatuta <> nicker necro ငြီးငွေ့ ngri:ngwe.

𓈖 𓆓 𓇛 𓅓 ⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉⲙ <> nectar νε- or νη- "not" plus κτα- or κτεν- "kill", meaning "unkillable", thus "immortal" 𓈖 𓆓 𓇛 𓅓 ⲛⲟⲩⲧⲉⲙ <> 𓂜𓏱 •nec.muer™ nectar "immortal" *neḱ- (“perish, disappear”) + *-tr̥h₂ (“overcoming”) <> necro

𒅃 kiši₁₁ chaos : "the Netherworld" Akk. kurnugi kar negro / necro
